Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class MarketBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.MarketBoard
public class MarketBoard
extends java.lang.Object
the class cointains 2 attributes board is a matrix that contains all the marbles that are available during the "Taking resources from the market" action

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    MarketBoard()
    constructor, each ball is put in a deterministic order, you have to use the method shuffle (maybe in a future version it will be included inside the constructor) it's needed for deterministic testing

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void ChangeBoard​(boolean switcher, int line)
    method used to change the board after a selection is done it doesn't update the view, so a new call to the method used to view the state is needed
    int[] ConversionToArray​(boolean switcher, int line)
    this is used a return function which gives back an int array which is 6 units long; it cointains the numbers of each resource in the selected row/column (in the standard coins->servants->shields->stones->faith order) the benefits is that the length of the array is pre-determined as 6.
    Resource[] ConvertionToResource​(boolean switcher, int line)
    this is the "beta" of a return function which gives an array with the resources gained from the selection
    Marble[][] getBoard()  
    Marble getSlideMarble()  
    void printBoard()
    method that prints the state of the board it already allines the board, so it's easier to visualize, used for testing
    void printGivenResources​(boolean switcher, int line)
    method used to print the resource gained from the action
    void shuffle()
    this method is needed to perform a random shuffle on the board it uses the .math class to perform the generation of a random position for each iteration of the cycle it implements a version of the Fisher-Yates shuffle adapted for shuffling a matrix the probabilities are slightly modified compared to the basic physical game, all changes are reported here: the probability of a specific ball being in a specific place is unchanged, but the probability of a specific ball being outside (as the SlideMarble) is changed the % of a white ball being outside at the start of the game is 25% instead of 30% the % of a red ball being outside at the start of the game is 8.2% instead of 7.5% the % of a resource-colored ball being outside at the start of the game is 16.7% instead of 15% this is due to the fact that at the start of the random generation an already determined ball is outside the game as a slideMarble, then after shuffling the board a new ball is chosen, but that influences slightly the odds of a specific ball being outside.
    MarbleColor[][] status()  

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • MarketBoard

      public MarketBoard()
      constructor, each ball is put in a deterministic order, you have to use the method shuffle (maybe in a future version it will be included inside the constructor) it's needed for deterministic testing

  • Method Details

    • getSlideMarble

      public Marble getSlideMarble()

    • getBoard

      public Marble[][] getBoard()

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      this method is needed to perform a random shuffle on the board it uses the .math class to perform the generation of a random position for each iteration of the cycle it implements a version of the Fisher-Yates shuffle adapted for shuffling a matrix the probabilities are slightly modified compared to the basic physical game, all changes are reported here: the probability of a specific ball being in a specific place is unchanged, but the probability of a specific ball being outside (as the SlideMarble) is changed the % of a white ball being outside at the start of the game is 25% instead of 30% the % of a red ball being outside at the start of the game is 8.2% instead of 7.5% the % of a resource-colored ball being outside at the start of the game is 16.7% instead of 15% this is due to the fact that at the start of the random generation an already determined ball is outside the game as a slideMarble, then after shuffling the board a new ball is chosen, but that influences slightly the odds of a specific ball being outside.

    • ConvertionToResource

      public Resource[] ConvertionToResource​(boolean switcher, int line)
      this is the "beta" of a return function which gives an array with the resources gained from the selection
      Parameters:
      switcher - is needed to select if it's being searched a row (true) or a column (false)
      line - is needed to select the specific row/column
      Returns:
      returns an array of the Resource type, it's length is determined inside the method, could be 3 or 4.

    • ConversionToArray

      public int[] ConversionToArray​(boolean switcher, int line)
      this is used a return function which gives back an int array which is 6 units long; it cointains the numbers of each resource in the selected row/column (in the standard coins->servants->shields->stones->faith order) the benefits is that the length of the array is pre-determined as 6.
      the sixth space is used to store the number of white marbles, as it can be used with a leader to produce resources
      Parameters:
      switcher - is needed to select if it's being searched a row (true) or a column (false)
      line - is needed to select the specific row/column
      Returns:
      an array of length 6

    • ChangeBoard

      public void ChangeBoard​(boolean switcher, int line)
      method used to change the board after a selection is done it doesn't update the view, so a new call to the method used to view the state is needed
      Parameters:
      switcher - is needed to select if it's being searched a row (true) or a column (false)
      line - is needed to select the specific row/column

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      method that prints the state of the board it already allines the board, so it's easier to visualize, used for testing

    • printGivenResources

      public void printGivenResources​(boolean switcher, int line)
      method used to print the resource gained from the action
      Parameters:
      switcher - is needed to select if it's being searched a row (true) or a column (false)
      line - is needed to select the specific row/column

    • status

      public MarbleColor[][] status()
